title: How often does 'turn it off and on' solve your phone or computer problems? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most of the time when my Facebook lite app goes crazy, like, when it is stuck in the loading screen, and pressing the back button doesn't do anything either, I just go to apps (inside settings) and force-close the app and open it again. Like this process have to be done 50% of the time I open that app. And when I'm on mobile data, I often find I need to put the phone on Airplane mode and then re-enable the radio when the data connection goes erry. I get to doing this about half of the time if I'm on mobile data. I have not yet found a reason to switch the phone off because of any issue like a stuck etc. as I can remember. I sometimes have to disable my bluetooth speaker's connection and reconnect it, when I watch youtube while my phone on a wifi connection. I don't watch videos on mobile data, but I sometimes find that my wifi, sort of interfering (🤷 ) with the bluetooth connection. And I sometimes have to restart my PC when it's frozen

When certain app begin to visibly slow down (Google Maps lately I often reach for the power-off function. On the other hand, keeping my iPhone X off for extended periods of time sometimes presents additional problems: many apps ask me to re-login.
